title: What are the characteristics of post modernism? - Quora

response.answer_text: Postmodernism is a catchall term that gained resonance in the 1960s whose adherents deny the unitary existence of concepts that had previously been deemed Eternal Truths. Reality is a myth a postmodern would say. All that we see, hear, and feel and think of as solidly grounded is provisional, temporary, and ephemeral. Reality is no more than an ideological human construct.

I found this explanation very useful: “Classical assumptions—that there was a reality we all agreed on, that language was adequate to describe it, that stories had a beginning, middle, and end—were classical, not modern.” Joan Acocella, The New Yorker, March 6, 2000: Susan Sontag, the Hunger Artist
